exercise: text = 'Python'. Try to change the first character to 'J' directly. What happens?
word = 'Hello'. Can you replace the 'e' with 'a' by directly modifying the string?
language = 'Python'. What happens when you run: language[0] = 'p'?
name = 'James'. Try to make it lowercase by changing the first character directly.
text = 'abc123'. Try changing the '1' to 'x' directly. What message appears?
word = 'Programming'. What alternative approach could you use to create a new string with 'C' instead of 'P'?
text = 'immutable'. What approaches can you use to change a character without modifying the original?
sentence = 'The sky is blue'. Can you create a reference to this string that allows modification?
word = 'Example'. Create a new string where the 'E' is replaced with 'e' without modifying the original.
text = 'Python'. When you set another variable new_text = text, can you modify new_text to change text too?
name = 'Robert'. Create a new string where 'Robert' becomes 'Bobert' without modifying the original.
language = 'Python'. Compare the memory ids of language and a newly created string 'Python'.
text = 'abcdef'. Replace the third character with 'X' without modifying the original string.
password = 'secret123'. Create a censored version with asterisks replacing all but the first and last characters.
name = 'Elizabeth'. Create a nickname by extracting characters without modifying the original.
word = 'banana'. Create a new string where all 'a' characters are replaced with 'o'.
text = 'Python'. Create a new string where each character is doubled without modifying the original.
code = 'abc123xyz'. Replace all digits with '#' without modifying the original string.
text = 'swap case'. Create a new string where lowercase letters become uppercase and vice versa.
message = 'Hello, World!'. Create a new string with vowels removed without modifying the original.
